new_value: {"notes":"Secondary issue: some polecats burn through 100% context before completing work (fury hit 0% on cm-v13, compacted, then couldn't recover). This may be related to the polecat prompt being too large, or the work beads being underspecified. Fury was assigned OasisOLC permission testing (cm-v13) and spent all context exploring code before writing tests."}
old_value: {"id":"gt-u6t","title":"Polecats don't self-terminate after gt done — zombie at idle prompt","description":"Systemic issue: Claude polecats complete their work, run gt done successfully (MR submitted to merge queue), but then sit at an idle prompt instead of exiting. This creates zombie sessions that consume polecat slots and require manual nuke cycles. Observed with 15+ polecats across multiple sling batches on 2026-02-27/28. The witness should detect idle-after-done polecats and clean them up, or gt done itself should exit the Claude Code session after successful submission. Current behavior forces the mayor to repeatedly check all polecats, verify they're done, and manually nuke them — burning mayor context on janitor work.","status":"open","priority":1,"issue_type":"bug","owner":"shane.werner@gmail.com","created_at":"2026-02-28T02:11:17Z","created_by":"mayor","updated_at":"2026-02-28T02:11:17Z"}

{"id":"gt-14b","title":"Fix Gemini agent startup bug - sessions crash within minutes","description":"Gemini CLI (v0.31.0) sessions die shortly after starting when used as a Gas Town agent (refinery, witness, etc). The session starts, primes successfully, begins work, then crashes. This has been observed repeatedly with the cmtestsuite refinery role. The gemini binary is installed via nvm/node 20. Need to investigate why Gemini sessions are unstable and fix or document workaround. Check if it's a timeout, auth, node version, or CLI compatibility issue. The gt-gemini-wrapper at /home/shane/bin/gt-gemini-wrapper was previously used but user prefers calling gemini directly.","status":"open","priority":1,"issue_type":"bug","owner":"shane.werner@gmail.com","created_at":"2026-02-28T20:20:10Z","created_by":"mayor","updated_at":"2026-02-28T20:20:10Z"}

{"description":"attached_molecule: gt-wisp-77e5p
attached_formula: mol-polecat-work
attached_at: 2026-02-28T20:20:22Z
dispatched_by: mayor

Gemini CLI (v0.31.0) sessions die shortly after starting when used as a Gas Town agent (refinery, witness, etc). The session starts, primes successfully, begins work, then crashes. This has been observed repeatedly with the cmtestsuite refinery role. The gemini binary is installed via nvm/node 20. Need to investigate why Gemini sessions are unstable and fix or document workaround. Check if it's a timeout, auth, node version, or CLI compatibility issue. The gt-gemini-wrapper at /home/shane/bin/gt-gemini-wrapper was previously used but user prefers calling gemini directly."}

new_value: Root cause was broken zone ordering in CircleMUD world index files (cm-vd8d). Fixed and pushed. Refinery/witness crash was downstream of MUD startup failure.

{"description":"Mail notifications are not reliably interrupting agent workflows. Multiple failure modes observed:

1. **Mayor**: ESCALATION-level mail from witness arrives as 'QUEUED NUDGE' system-reminder but Mayor ignores it because the reminder says 'Continue current work unless the nudge is higher priority.' Mayor never checks if it IS higher priority.

2. **Refinery**: Got stuck for 17+ minutes on a deleted branch (dust/cm-y58g). Witness sent escalation mail AND nudges, but nudge text appeared as raw keyboard input in the stuck shell (^[[B sequences). The nudge mechanism (gt nudge) injects text into tmux but doesn't interrupt a running process.

3. **Witness → Refinery path**: Witness correctly detected the stuck refinery and sent mail + nudges, but had no mechanism to actually kill/restart the stuck session. Witness can only observe and report.

4. **General pattern**: gt nudge sends text to tmux stdin, which only works if the agent is at a prompt waiting for input. If the agent is mid-tool-call or a subprocess is running, the nudge gets eaten or appears as garbage in the terminal.

Root causes to investigate:
- gt nudge reliability when target agent is not at prompt
- Mail priority routing (ESCALATION should force interrupt, not just queue)
- Agent polling discipline (should agents check mail between tool calls?)
- Whether hooks (UserPromptSubmit) should force-inject high-priority mail into agent context more aggressively","priority":1,"title":"Mail notifications not interrupting agents — systemic across all roles"}
old_value: {"id":"gt-vf7","title":"Mayor not receiving real-time mail notifications","description":"Mail notifications arrive as system-reminder QUEUED NUDGE blocks but Mayor doesn't act on them unless the human points them out. The notification system says 'Continue current work unless the nudge is higher priority' which causes Mayor to ignore ESCALATION-level messages. Need either: (1) a hook that interrupts Mayor workflow for HIGH/ESCALATION mail, or (2) Mayor startup instructions to poll inbox after every tool call batch, or (3) a different notification mechanism that forces attention. Currently mail only gets checked when Mayor happens to run gt mail inbox manually.","status":"open","priority":1,"issue_type":"bug","owner":"shane.werner@gmail.com","created_at":"2026-02-28T23:55:26Z","created_by":"mayor","updated_at":"2026-02-28T23:55:26Z"}
